summary: All round 1 security findings addressed. SA-1: SecureRandom reused as class property; entropy zeroed in finally block. SA-2: seed byte arrays zeroed in finally blocks for all derivation methods. SA-3: WalletKeys.toString() now redacts mnemonic, btcPrivateKeyWIF, and ethPrivateKeyHex. New test testWalletKeys_toStringRedactsSensitiveFields validates the redaction. No remaining security concerns.
